(Sarah of the Clue Crew reports from the Dittrick Medical History Center in Cleveland, OH.)  Sometimes during surgery, the heart convulses, loses rhythm & stops pumping blood; Cleveland surgeon Claude Beck used cardiac massage & applied electrical current directly to the heart to reverse the phenomenon usingthisdevice; those techniques led him to develop CPR
